MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Assesses the candidate's hands-on coding skills, knowledge of relevant technologies, and ability to design and implement software solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate through coding challenges, technical interviews, and review of past projects/portfolio. Focus on the depth of knowledge, problem-solving skills, and code quality.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited coding skills; struggles with basic concepts and technologies; unable to design basic solutions.
Adequate coding skills; understands core concepts but needs guidance; can implement simple designs.
Strong coding skills; proficient in relevant technologies; capable of designing and implementing complex solutions independently.
Exceptional coding skills; expert in multiple technologies; drives technical innovation and provides mentorship.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluates the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Use case studies, scenario-based questions, and technical puzzles during interviews. Assess their logical reasoning, critical thinking, and attention to detail.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to analyze problems; unable to identify root causes; proposes ineffective or illogical solutions.
Can analyze simple problems; identifies obvious root causes; proposes adequate solutions with guidance.
Analyzes complex problems effectively; identifies underlying root causes; develops creative and efficient solutions independently.
Exceptional problem-solving skills; anticipates potential problems; develops innovative and strategic solutions that have a significant impact.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration Skills: Assesses the candidate's ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences, and work collaboratively in a team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Observe communication style during interviews, assess ability to explain technical concepts clearly, and gather feedback from previous colleagues or team members (if possible).

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills; struggles to explain technical concepts; ineffective in a team environment.
Adequate communication skills; explains basic concepts clearly; participates in team discussions but may not contribute significantly.
Strong communication skills; explains complex concepts clearly and concisely; actively contributes to team discussions and collaborates effectively.
Exceptional communication skills; effectively communicates with diverse audiences; fosters a collaborative and inclusive team environment.

MainCategory.Description: Experience: Quantity and Quality of software-engineer-related projects.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Checking the number of years of experience, technologies, and the difficulty of past project scopes. Focus on the depth of knowledge, problem-solving skills, and code quality.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Little to no professional experience. Lacks basic understanding of the practical aspects of development.
Has some professional experience, but projects are basic in scope, and the candidate may not have been the primary driver.
Solid experience with multiple projects and technologies, demonstrating a good understanding of software-engineer best practices.
Deep and broad experience on many kinds of systems and problems. Experience with different languages and has made important technical contributions.

SubCategory.Description: Object-Oriented Design (OOD):  Assess the understanding and proper use of inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Pose questions relating to data structures and assessing understanding.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Not able to describe OOD or explain the advantages
Can adequately describe, but does not show experience with the design practice.
Can describe and has experience with OOD. Can determine when it's appropriate to use.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality and Testing:  The use of code reviews, test-driven development (TDD) and debugging tools.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate how they normally check their work and what their approach is to finding problems in their code.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Quality assurance is not a consideration.
Has a process for testing, but attention to detail is lacking.
Uses industry standard methods and understands the need for rigorous testing.

SubCategory.Description: Teamwork & Communication: Understands the importance of working with a team.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about a time when they were behind schedule on a joint project and how they handled it.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Does not have any consideration of teamwork.
Is willing to listen to others, but is not proactive.
Is willing to share ideas and make sure deadlines are met.

SubCategory.Description: Staying Current:  Is tapped into industry trends.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Asking candidates what resources they would recommend to someone looking to become a better software engineer.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Not current and does not understand the landscape.
Is aware of some of the technologies, but cannot explain why they are relevant.
Is actively keeping up with technical publications and can articulate the trends.
